content:
That's great! Collecting vintage cameras can be a fascinating hobby, and it's wonderful that you're interested in learning more about the history of cameras and photography techniques.

The 1960s-era Canon rangefinder camera you bought is a great addition to your collection. Rangefinder cameras are known for their compact size, mechanical simplicity, and excellent optical quality. Canon is a well-respected brand in the photography industry, and their rangefinder cameras from the 1960s are highly sought after by collectors.

Watching YouTube videos is an excellent way to learn about camera collecting and photography techniques. There are many knowledgeable and experienced collectors and photographers on YouTube who share their expertise and showcase their collections.

It's great that you're interested in learning about the history of cameras and the different types of film that were used. Film photography has a rich history, and understanding the different film stocks and development processes can help you appreciate the art of photography even more.

If you're interested in learning more about film photography, you might want to consider shooting with film yourself. There are many resources available online, including tutorials, workshops, and communities of film photographers who can provide guidance and support.

Additionally, you might want to consider joining online forums or social media groups dedicated to camera collecting and photography. These communities can be a great resource for learning more about cameras, sharing your knowledge with others, and connecting with like-minded individuals.

Do you have any plans to restore or modify your Canon rangefinder camera, or do you plan to keep it in its original condition?
